# UIModalTransitionStyle.flipHorizontal | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ UIKit ](/documentation/uikit)

- [ UIModalTransitionStyle ](/documentation/uikit/uimodaltransitionstyle)

- [ UIModalTransitionStyle.flipHorizontal ](/documentation/UIKit/UIModalTransitionStyle/flipHorizontal)

- [ UIModalTransitionStyle ](/documentation/uikit/uimodaltransitionstyle)

-  UIModalTransitionStyle.flipHorizontal 

Case# UIModalTransitionStyle.flipHorizontal

iOSiPadOSMac CatalystvisionOS

```
case flipHorizontal
```

## [Discussion](/documentation/UIKit/UIModalTransitionStyle/flipHorizontal#Discussion)

When the view controller is presented, the current view initiates a horizontal 3D flip from right-to-left, resulting in the revealing of the new view as if it were on the back of the previous view. On dismissal, the flip occurs from left-to-right, returning to the original view.

## [See Also](/documentation/UIKit/UIModalTransitionStyle/flipHorizontal#see-also)
